title: Tennessee Williams: theater in process
creator_credit: Richard Slote, Suzanne Tedesko, Signet Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the production of the play “The red devil battery sign” by Tennessee Williams. Tennessee Williams talks about his career and about writing a play and how he works with a director rather than with the actors. The film shows a press conference, rehearsals of lines and then full rehearsals during which the director conveys his interpretation of some of the important symbols and speeches in the play
